did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
did.abstract: Personal and professional papers and student papers.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Cornell University history professor and specialist in upstate New York history.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Personal and professional papers and student papers. Student papers were written by students in Professor Kammen's History 126 course in response to assignments calling for newspaper and archives research; and for interviews regarding student life, folklore, and slang. Papers are journal entries, memoirs, or critiques of campus life.

Pen and certificate commemorating the signing of legislation creating the New York State freedom trail program, 1997. Scrapbook compiled by students in summer 2004 CAU course. Correspondence with Heriberto Dixon and file on Cayuga land claims. Correspondence relating to New York State history, and letters from Indonesia and East Timor. Files on "Cornell: Glorious to View," and files and unused materials for "First Person Cornell." Photograph album from a trip to China, Dec. 1982-Jan. 1983, with pictures of Beijing, Loying, Wuxi, Soujo, and the Li River.

Files on being a local historian, including letters, book contracts, invitations to speak, and responses, 1979-2012; research files from "Part & Apart"; and research files relating to Cornell women's history.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: College students--New York (State)--Ithaca--Social life and customs.
College students--Attitudes.
College students--Conduct of life.
College students' writings, English--New York (State)--Ithaca.
Folklore--Study and teaching.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Closed until January 1, 2035 unless authorized by donor.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on use:
userestrict.p: Boxes 34-37, 39-44 (student papers) not restricted. Authors of student papers retain the literary rights.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Carol Kammen papers, #4295. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
